activities.name: Vampire Café
activities.description: A taste of the macabre Tokyo's ritzy shopping district.

activities.name: The Giant Ghibli Clock
activities.description: Tokyo’s only Vaudeville-cuckoo clock–steampunk-Victorian curio cabinet time piece.

activities.name: Omoide Yokocho
activities.description: Colloquially known as “piss alley,” this narrow street filled with tiny bars and barbecue stands looks like it was pulled straight out of “Blade Runner.”

activities.name: Sanrio Puroland
activities.description: If Hello Kitty were Mickey Mouse, this would be Disneyland.

activities.name: Gotokuji Temple
activities.description: The legendary birthplace of the Japanese maneki-neko is dotted with hundreds of lucky beckoning cats.

activities.name: Godzilla Head
activities.description: Not quite the menace it once was, this monster still has some chops.

activities.name: Sengaku-Ji
activities.description: This Buddhist temple is home to the graves of the Japanese national legends, the 47 Ronin.

activities.name: Akihabara Electric Town
activities.description: Once a black market electronics marketplace, now an otaku shopper's paradise.

activities.name: Harukor
activities.description: Tokyo’s only Ainu restaurant serves Indigenous food from northern Japan.
